website_summaries.verdict: A reversible sleeve-style wrist brace that works especially well for those who experience unpredictable, asymmetrical flares.
pros: Versatile design can be worn on either the left or right wrist simply by removing and reinserting the rigid palmar splint
Soft and comfortable enough for all-day use
Easily adjustable Velcro straps offer customizable compression
cons: Velcro fasteners lose grip after a while

customer_reviews.title: Metal bar digs in to your arm
customer_reviews.text: The brace has a removable metal bar so it can be ambidextrous. The problem with it is that this bar is about 1/4" shorter that the pouch it slides in to, presumably so it can be easily removed without too much effort. This ease of removal however also allows the bar to poke out of the slit and dig in to your arm. I am frequently having to adjust the bar to push it back all the way in to its pouch. I can probably fix this by sewing the slit shut, however I really shouldnt need to do this. This could have been avoided with a better product design.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing these to bed, and occasionally at the keyboard, off and on for over a year. They're very comfortable, and help with the worst of my wrist pain. They don't immobilize, but do offer support. They do a great job of keeping my wrists from being bent at all sorts of fun angles while tossing and turning in bed. The velcro will wear out over time (hence my replacement purchase). I've found it's better just to leave the velcro attached at all times, and slide it on and off my wrist. There's just enough elasticity.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Needs some changes to be more comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Overall I think this brace is very good. It helped stabilize a broken left wrist very well. Where it falls down is the lack of padding around the thumb hole, the stitching there ends up quite painful, and rubs raw the skin between the thumb and forefinger. Wadded-up tissue, particularly moisturized tissue, helps. Another issue is that with a recently broken wrist, it is impossible to put this brace on without modification, because the sleeve is too tight. The elastic part of the sleeve can be cut with scissors to allow the brace to be wrapped around the wrist. I can confirm it is machine washable.
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT S CREW

customer_reviews.title: Decent Product, Decent Price
customer_reviews.text: Does the job, helps with my wrist pain due to tendinitis. I like that it's reversible, too many of them aren't. However, it doesn't beat the original Futuro Reversible Splint that I've retired after years of use. The original conformed much better to my wrist even when I first got it, possibly because it wasn't one-size-fits-all like this one. Point is, this one still works well enough when needed, so, worth the buy.
customer_reviews.author: SLM

customer_reviews.title: Unraveled but fixable. Comfy brace.
customer_reviews.text: This is probably one of the most comfortable and effective braces I've used for carpal tunnel. Unfortunately, the strips that attach to the velcro all unraveled and came off. I had to sew them back on myself. For the price I paid, its annoying and it started happening literally within 30 minutes of wearing it the first time. I was able to fix it and it's now on my wrist and comfy again.
customer_reviews.author: JosieDahling

customer_reviews.title: Very good support
customer_reviews.text: It is as it says, moderate support. Seems to be well made but only time will tell how long it will last. I have other wrist bands from another brand and the velcro does not lasts. I like the design and on this one, it is not too bulky. I can wear it in the office and it does not look like so dramatic like others. I do recommend, excellent for the price. I will buy another one soon.
customer_reviews.author: ROQ

customer_reviews.title: Works great for me!
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing this 24x7 for over a month. It is very comfortable, and breathable! As my swelling has diminished, the straps have worked great to customize the fit. For my condition (SLAC wrist), the cut out for the thumb needed to be a bit lower. I was able to cut a small section out without ill effects. I have seen other reviewers say that theirs is showing signs of wear very quickly. So far, mine hasn't. I machine wash it in a lingerie bag with clothes on a gentle cycle, cold water. I line dry it; it dries quickly. I am pleased with the product.
customer_reviews.author: M. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Ok to wear but not for typing.
customer_reviews.text: Fits right for my large hands but little uncomfortable to get me typing or holding mouse. I found the wellgate product from my mom as the perfect one for typing though smaller to my hands but they unfortunately don't manufacture products for men Also, the metal wrist support is coming off from the brace and sometimes hurts the wrist
customer_reviews.author: KbK

customer_reviews.title: If not constantly washed they develop a bad smell. And they start to fall apart practically ...
customer_reviews.text: They are cheaper on Amazon then in the store. Not worth the $25.00 at store price. They are defiantly an $11.00 product. The velcro started to wear out first week. If not constantly washed they develop a bad smell. And they start to fall apart practically immediately. Right out of the box there was loose strings on the stitching I made the mistake of pulling one and they almost pulled the velcro attachment off. I had to retie and burn.
customer_reviews.author: Jason P Punchard

customer_reviews.title: Carpal tunnel survivor
customer_reviews.text: Got two because I have carpal tunnel in both my wrists and I use them for all occasions! They do hurt my nerve damage in my wrists if i wear them too long and the metal part will soon bust through the top but still good!
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Vals

customer_reviews.title: I can sleep now!
customer_reviews.text: Well, I never thought the reason my arms were going numb and my hands throb and burn while I was sleeping was because of carpel tunnel in my wrists. THE FIRST NIGHT I wore these wrist splints I had NO pain and slept all night and every night since. They are light weight and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Kramer

customer_reviews.title: I love this brace!
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this brace. I have to wear a brace pretty much 24/7, and this is comfortable, provides the support I need, and the fact that it's machine washable makes it even better!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Not the greatest quality
customer_reviews.text: I have had this wrist brace for less than a year, and while it has helped with my carpal tunnel, the quality of the product is lacking. I own two of them, one for each wrist, and they both have fallen apart. The Velcro is not very sticky anymore, and the stitching that holds the Velcro tabs on is coming off. I have only washed them once, so it is not from the washing machine. They just are made very cheaply. I would not recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Item arrived in poor condition
customer_reviews.text: This item came today and I was excited to start using it, but sadly the item is defective, the stitching was undone as you can see in the picture. Amazon return link says I can't return the item. This will be my last purchase from amazon. Very disappointed in this item.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie R.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality brace
customer_reviews.text: As expected. I had one of these before and needed to replace it because of the old one starting to fray. Amazon had a better price than stores around me.
customer_reviews.author: Jjacks15

customer_reviews.title: I GOT FOR RADIAL NERVE PALSEY!  WORKS FOR ME!
customer_reviews.text: It's short! For wrist, not arm or finger. I had some moderate pain with complex Radial Nerve PALSY. (a.k.a. SATURDAY NIGHT PALSEY - SLOWLY SLOWLY, SLOWLY, COMING BACK!- FROM SLEEPING ON RADIAL NERVE MULTI MONTHS, O(T, EXERCISE S, ETC) IT HELPS AND ITS REALLY MADE BY 3M. (FUTORO). WELL MADE. WORKS WELL. GOT AT DIRECTION OF MY OCCUPATIONAL/THERAPIST. GOOD LUCK!
customer_reviews.author: Floobydust

customer_reviews.title: Buy Only For Small Wrists!
customer_reviews.text: Adjustable, one size fits all my behind. I'm not a very large-wristed guy and this brace is just too small. It fits, but it's tight before I even apply the velcro. I'll wear it during the daytime but it'll be too tight for nighttime wear. This brace replaces a Futuro wrist brace that was listed as a size large and it was just right for me. It's no longer available. Too bad I didn't order a pair or more when I had the chance.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent DeSimone

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: My mom has bad arthritis. I bought 2 for her and she immediately noticed a difference. She said it helped alot. It works !!!
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Works but Rubs in the thumb area
customer_reviews.text: I tried this on at Kaiser to make sure it fits properly and didn’t hurt. I got it today and I’ve worn it for 30mins and the thumb area is rubbing on my skin and causing irritation
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and effective.
customer_reviews.text: I use this wrist wrap every night to sleep and it has virtually eliminated my carpal tunnel and neck tension issues. What makes this wrist support great is that it is a little longer than standard, so it doesn't dig in at the end when I accidentally try to bend my wrist at night. Other supports have given me bruises at the end after one use, but never with this one. It is also very flexible about size on the bigger end. It's not for little arms, but fits average to very large wrists and arms perfectly and comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Average
customer_reviews.text: I got this item today and to me the packaging was beat up and when I opened it the brace smelled used and I decided to hand wash it. So this is super inconvenient since right now I am waiting for it to air dry. So beware that packaging may not be new.
customer_reviews.author: Lunamoon

customer_reviews.title: Be sure of the style is right for you
customer_reviews.text: I can only say, it didn't work for me. Realized after I got it, wrong style for me.
customer_reviews.author: Just Jo

customer_reviews.title: Great wrist brace!
customer_reviews.text: I broke my wrist and needed a brace after my operation. The one my doctor provided me with was painful to wear. I looked at and bought several to try and found this one was comfortable, easy to put on and sturdy. I am still wearing it at night to support my wrist while I sleep. Such a bargain and so happy I found it.
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: Wrist Saver
customer_reviews.text: I had one from a few years back and the small Velcro by the thumb and first finger is wearing out so I ordered another one. I would highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Nancy M

customer_reviews.title: Love Reversible
customer_reviews.text: I like most that is reversible! Comfortable and your fingers are free.
customer_reviews.author: Andres

customer_reviews.title: What a difference
customer_reviews.text: Fingers not tingling and numb now. I guess I do have a little carpal tunnel whatzit going on.
customer_reviews.author: C.C. Comment

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: When my old wrist brace died (after 3 yes of use), I started shopping around. I tried a different brand that was made for small/medium wrists, but it was horrible. Amazon had the best price for this item as I checked Target and other local stores. From the previous reviews, I get what they say about the Velcro - I don't know how long this products will last because of that. But so far, this product fits me and works as well as my old brace.
customer_reviews.author: JT Ferris

customer_reviews.title: Helps my carpal tunnel whil sleeping
customer_reviews.text: I've had these splints for a month. They reverse easily to be used on the left hand. The velcro strips are small, but they are holding well. The material seems to breath well and doesn't hold perspiration. I use these splints at night and they do not bother me while sleeping.
customer_reviews.author: Vickie A. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Good basic splint for Carpel Tunnel
customer_reviews.text: Works as a down and dirty splint that is replacing the one from my doc that only lasted a couple of weeks. He was going to send me to an orthotic shop for a custom, but I don't even want to guess at how much that would run. This is a solid value that's getting the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Sisyphean

customer_reviews.title: WRIST SUPPORT
customer_reviews.text: FIT IS VERY GOOD, SUPPORT IS GOOD (MODERATE STABILIZING), THE VELCRO SYSTEM IS NOT VERY ROBUST, BUT ONCE ADJUSTED AND IF YOUR WRIST DOES NOT HURT TOO MUCH, IT CAN BE EASILY SLIPPED ON AND OFF WITHOUT OPENING THE VELCRO STRAPS.
customer_reviews.author: GREYWATER

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: The design allows interchange wrist. You can remove the bar to wash the glove.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I have the sport one but want to try the new style. It s working great
customer_reviews.author: Yosa

customer_reviews.title: While not the worst I've ever tried
customer_reviews.text: While not the worst I've ever tried, there's a big design problem with these braces. Because of where the opening is on the interior pockets where you place the metal support bar and the length of the bar itself, the very bottom edge of the metal bar was constantly poking outside of the pocket. This meant that the sharp metal edge of the bar digs into my arm constantly. Forget uncomfortable, it's downright painful. If the openings were in a different place so that the metal bar didn't poke out, these would be decent braces--not great, but decent. A shame, because other Futuro braces I've bought have worked out well.
customer_reviews.author: Haley

customer_reviews.title: I was  so happy to find this design again after years of searching .
customer_reviews.text: II have rheumatoid arthritis mostly in th wrists and hands. Fifteen years ago i bought a set of Futuro wrist splints which I loved. I had never been able to find the same design since and I've bought a dozen trying. They were all too bulky, rough or scratchy. These are almost the same design and so soft and velvetly. Love them
customer_reviews.author: Billye H. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with quality and design
customer_reviews.text: I used the previous model for years, usually getting about 9 to 12 months use from a splint. On this model, the stitching for the middle velcro strap has already failed after six weeks. I also had to enlarge the thumb hole, which I did not have to do on the older model (which was available in different sizes - this is a "one-size-fits-all" approach). The original hole was causing my thumb to turn red.
customer_reviews.author: Sierra Foothills

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great support for my wrist and hand, highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Just the right amount of support
customer_reviews.text: For a short while, I had some pain in my wrist. Using this Futuro wrist strap helped to mitigate the pain and eventually made it go away completely. The fact that it is reversible is also a huge plus. Moderate support provides just enough support so you can still have mobility in your wrists and hands. The velcro straps are also easy to handle and seem like they will last quite some time. This is the second one I buy. Overall, I am very satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Didn't fit well
customer_reviews.text: Interesting device, but it did not fit my wrist/hand well so not much help. Alas, although this was an Amazon Prime order, buried in the fine print well down the page is a disclaimer "not returnable." My bad. Wouldn't have ordered it if there was no return option.
customer_reviews.author: VeroGuy

customer_reviews.title: Skin Irritation
customer_reviews.text: I used it on my left hand, it did limit my wrist movement, and was good for preventing further damage to the wrist. However in 2 days, it developed burning skin irritations at the edges and area between thumb and index fingers due to the friction from the inside of the brace (rough surface at the seams). Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Value-oriented Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Rough and prickly seam inside the brace
customer_reviews.text: I could not wear this wrist brace. It's very uncomfortable, because it has rough and prickly seam inside the brace. Unfortunately the seller does not accept returns.
customer_reviews.author: vds

customer_reviews.title: It's very easy to reverse on which wrist to wear it
customer_reviews.text: I've used this mostly at night, while sleeping. It's very easy to reverse on which wrist to wear it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon J Matthews

customer_reviews.title: ... hurting at work and the metal bar inside is better than the soft braces
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my wrist from hurting at work and the metal bar inside is better than the soft braces. Works for both left and right.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't limit me an excessive amount while providing excellent support.
customer_reviews.text: I sprained my wrist in a car accident and this was by far the most supportive brace that gave a little wiggle room. It's itchy at first but once it's "broken in" that goes away. It doesn't limit me an excessive amount while providing excellent support.
customer_reviews.author: brendaleigh

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably priced and well made
customer_reviews.text: What more could you ask for? I purchased this after looking at wrist supports at Wal-Mart. They were overpriced (I thought) and there wasn't much selection so I decided to turn to Amazon, once again. This wrist brace/support is great for my small wrists and provides relief. Plus, I love the fact that it's reversible because i tend to have problems with both wrists.
customer_reviews.author: Stef B

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Great material, comfortable to wear and does exactly what is suppose to be doing. I like that you can wear it in both hands ans it is always useful to have it around.
customer_reviews.author: Nikolas

customer_reviews.title: Best splints I have ever tried
customer_reviews.text: Did not relieve the carpel tunnel, not even reversible as stated and could not return as they are considered a personnel product
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Used this product instead of going to the doctor.It worked
customer_reviews.text: Helped to stabilize my wrist as an aid in my recovery.Dont know what I would have done without it!
customer_reviews.author: Tanya L Riley

customer_reviews.title: Great if you need to wear a brace at night.
customer_reviews.text: I had severe tendonitis and had to wear braces on both wrists at night for over a year. Once I found this little beauty I slept much better, no longer waking in the middle of the night to adjust the overly stiff braces the doctor provided. The comfort level is wonderful and once you adjust the fitting to your liking there is no need to unvelcro allowing you to simply slip it on and off as needed. Lightweight and very soft on the skin. Go for it, you won't be dissapointed.
customer_reviews.author: E. Landry

customer_reviews.title: Good fit
customer_reviews.text: These wrist braces are great. They are a good fit and are comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Its a little small if you have big hands, ...
customer_reviews.text: Its a little small if you have big hands, but gives up over time, and works as expected to improve RSI.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel B.

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE that is reversible and you can remove the metal ...
customer_reviews.text: I am on the computer 8+ hours a day and this wrist brace is a god send. I LOVE that is reversible and you can remove the metal brace piece and just toss it in the washer and dryer when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Good price, good product
customer_reviews.text: Been using it for about a month. Works well. Sturdy, comfortable, I use it at work. It keeps my wrist supported and isn't super bulky. I like that the Velcro is very adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: beawitched

customer_reviews.title: Good but velcro issues
customer_reviews.text: Product is good and very comfortable. Only complaint is the first velcro grip loses its grip very quickly. I thought it was a defect on the one I got but the 2nd one developed the same issue at the same spot.
customer_reviews.author: v0rt3x

customer_reviews.title: Stitching comes apart after a few months use.
customer_reviews.text: Don't plan to use it more than a few months. The stitching comes apart and the metal support will start to slide out into your palm.
customer_reviews.author: Peebo

customer_reviews.title: This place is nice and thin but works very well
customer_reviews.text: I have to wear this brace every day when I use the computer due to forearm pain. This place is nice and thin but works very well. Very unobtrusive
customer_reviews.author: el Jefe'

customer_reviews.title: Great for stability.
customer_reviews.text: Used for carpal tunnel syndrome. Wish product was in flesh color.
customer_reviews.author: Maryann terwilliger

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this product. My son reminded me of its good features as compared to others. Tricky to find the metal support to change from right to left hand....it comes out of a slit at the top.
customer_reviews.author: Charletta C. Bell

customer_reviews.title: comfortable fit
customer_reviews.text: needed a new one this is a repurchase this splint fits the best for my carpal tunnel issues.
customer_reviews.author: pamala

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: This is really great. Slim fitting and not so bulky as the one my doctor prescribed to me, but still does the trick!
customer_reviews.author: Lori Hunt

customer_reviews.title: The wrist braces are just great and help me so much during the time I ...
customer_reviews.text: The wrist braces are just great and help me so much during the time I am on the computer using them. No wrist pain!
customer_reviews.author: Marylee

customer_reviews.title: Worth the buy and more
customer_reviews.text: Worked as advertised. No surprises. I injured my wrist while playing. This definitely helped me a lot as I was about to travel soon after. Liked: Nice grip and versatility. Did not like: Small fibers started showing up on the surface.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: cheap not much better then a ACE BANDAGE and a BAND AID, would fit a small cild
customer_reviews.author: KEVIN J

customer_reviews.title: I mostly like this product
customer_reviews.text: I give this brace 5 stars for functionality; it is really a great brace; however, I give it only three starts for durability; if gets fuzzy over time and eventually the velcro straps won't stick to the fabric
customer_reviews.author: statsman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The best wrist guard on the market. I own 2.
customer_reviews.author: KV_NY

customer_reviews.title: reversible  wrist guards
customer_reviews.text: work really great with my mild tendonitis/ carpal tunnel in my wrists.
customer_reviews.author: J M Theno

customer_reviews.title: excellent value
customer_reviews.text: I wear these every night for arthritis, and they have held up for 6 weeks, laundered OK. Seemed small but have proved adequate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Product smaller than advertised. Dimensions did not match those posted. Also, item was covered in light blue lint for some reason? I really hope it isn't used.
customer_reviews.author: FyreNWater

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I use this when I'm working and for my bowling league and it's EXACTLY what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Suzzanna

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Too big for my wrist. The part that touches around my thumb started bite into my hand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fits great on both hands and is quite comfortable to wear for extended periods.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Nice wrist splint
customer_reviews.text: Due to Ehlers Danlos, I have used many braces for wrist laxity and thumb instability and arthritis. This brace creates mild support and stability for the thumb joint but not great. It does hold stabilize the wrist to a good extent. It provides moderate stability for wrist rotation, not perfect. PROS Metal splint can be conformed to the shape of your wrist Gentle support and fairly comfortable Reversible design, (metal splint moves to either side) Better quality and support than many braces. Does not interfer with activity CONS Poor quality Velcro doesn’t last long Not great for basal thumb arthritis Offers mild (not good) stability
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: I used to wake up with numb fingers and hands ...
customer_reviews.text: I used to wake up with numb fingers and hands from carpel tunnel, I wear these every night and no more numb hands.
customer_reviews.author: Blair Grant

customer_reviews.title: It's okay........
customer_reviews.text: Although it does allow more freedom of movement, it is not as stabilizing as others that I've had. I wouldn't buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Certainly helped with the problem. Got very scruffy looking very quickly though.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Ruddick

customer_reviews.title: Best choice for me anyways.
customer_reviews.text: I have previously bought this model and another one, black and"for the left hand only". Every time I can't find one, I go looking for the other, and today, I found this one first after having one the left hand only one for weeks, 24/7. This is the better one, so now I a buying a second one, etc. Haven't washed one yet, but this model does not have a strap that keeps coming lose for lack of good velcro or something. Anyways, I found my way back to this one, and I wear it 24/7 too. My beagle sets on her haunches sometimes when she wants to sniff, and it just pull my tendons out.
customer_reviews.author: Geronimo

customer_reviews.title: Great Splint
customer_reviews.text: It meets my need and it good for either hand. Its affordable and comfortable. Gives the support that was needed and I like the fact that it is adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: Comfort!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product - it helps me so much when I sleep!!
customer_reviews.author: DIANE DEPIRO

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: only problem is that it doesn't look nice for long and metal brace slides up too often.
customer_reviews.author: Judith A. Fieldstone

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Excellent support for my wrist! Nice and durable. I would definitely recommend it for anyone who needs a splint support for their wrist!
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly, even with my large wrists and gives immediate pain relief. 5/5
customer_reviews.author: Sarai Cardoza

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I need for occasional flare-ups and much more reasonably priced at Amazon.com
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: its fine. not super great. Sometimes it makes my thumbs hurt. helps over-all.
customer_reviews.author: Reese Conn

customer_reviews.title: Not good for tennis or mouse elbow
customer_reviews.text: Computer mouse elbow or tennis elbow both cause pain to the lateral (outside) bone of the elbow, a cure requires a device that prevents the wrist from hyper extending up (splint on the back of the hand). This brace has a splint in the palm which prevents hyper extension down. This type of brace works well for golf elbow where elbow pain is on the inside elbow bone.
customer_reviews.author: Clay Gate

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: I've used Futuro wrist braces for many years. This particular brace is different from the previous ones, but I do like it very much.
customer_reviews.author: LeeAnn Wicker

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one hoping it would replace my old brace whose velcro was dying. This looked the closest to what I had and was hoping it would fit the same. Unfortunately it was far too small. The inner sleeve is cut extremely small and was uncomfortable tight. It was not even worth trying to close the straps before I took it off, since it was clear it would not be comfortable enough for extended usage.
customer_reviews.author: Madleina

customer_reviews.title: Great product, good price.
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality. My hand is almost back to normal once I started using this daily. Highly recommend. I have Carpal Tunnel and it flares up every now and then.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria H.

customer_reviews.title: So helpful for preventing pain
customer_reviews.text: I used it for first time when in the States and I decided to get it again. Durable, water resistant and so helpful
customer_reviews.author: Alberto Gil

customer_reviews.title: No Stink solution:  Well priced effective brace for wrist support
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my needs that I bought two after having two others that didn’t work out. Pros: — reversible so you don’t have to buy hand specific —lightweight and easy to put on or pull off —DOESN’T RETAIN ODORS. Wish I could say this over and over. I use mine for an acute wrist sprain especially at the gym or playing tennis and it gets sweaty and gross. It has a low stink factor and is easy to wash (Justin pull out the metal brace piece) —good price. Same brace in brick and mortar is $25 Cons: can’t really think of any.
customer_reviews.author: DotL

customer_reviews.title: Helps rest my wrists
customer_reviews.text: At least a few times a year, I end up with bad pains in my both of my wrists and forearms. My best guess is that it is tendonitis. This brace helps alleviate the pain significantly. And, it still allow me to use my hands. Some things are hard, like typing, but I am able to make it work. The only down side is that the metal pop us through the opening sometimes and causes minor skin irritation. Still, that is a small price to pay for how well this brace works, otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: M.T.

customer_reviews.title: great for carpel tunnel
customer_reviews.text: This brace is excellent for anyone suffering from carpel tunnel. I developed carpel tunnel during pregnancy and have struggled with it off and on ever since. This brace allows me to sleep all night because I don't wake up in pain from pinched nerves. I really like that it can be used on either hand just by switching the metal plate. I'm not sure the brace would fit someone with very large hands and arms, but it's perfect for an average overweight female.
customer_reviews.author: blayne7

customer_reviews.title: Worn daily at might, helps relieve pain
customer_reviews.text: Relieves pain and prevents my wrists from bending while I sleep. Helpful for carpel tunnel syndrome and a couple other wrist/hand/thumb ailments I have from living a long life. Lets me type daytime refreshed without old pains I used to have from bending wrists while asleep. Recommend. Easy to put on, bend metal to fit, and lasts decent time before fraying. Had them a while, will buy more again. Fits either hand.
customer_reviews.author: Ann E MKE WI

customer_reviews.title: happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: This brace can be used for both left and right wrist support. To change from different side, all you need to do is removed the metal piece and turn it to the opposite side, then put it back. I am not sure you can wash in the laundry or not. I will recommend handwashing and air-dry if it gets dirty. It is easy to put on and can be adjusted to fit different hand size.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Brown

customer_reviews.title: so I thought I'd really like this one
customer_reviews.text: I've used Futuro hand braces before, so I thought I'd really like this one. When I put it on, it was super comfortable. Unfortunately, after and hour or so of wearing it, I started to feel a little itchy. I took it off and saw the two red lines from the seams the hold the metal bar in place. These should be on the outside, not the inside. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price, but Velcro wears out eventually
customer_reviews.text: I buy one of these a year, which is about how long the Velcro tabs last. Effective support for carpal tunnel issues in my wrist. The reversible feature is handy (can work for right or left wrist) and the material breathes so it doesn't get whiffy from perspiration.
customer_reviews.author: bbc

customer_reviews.title: Not Intrusive, Good Brace
customer_reviews.text: I have a cystic tear on my left wrist's Ulna side that doesn't heal, so I wear this several hours a day so that I won't bend my wrist that direction. Of all the braces I've worn, this is the least intrusive and doesn't get in the way of my typing. I wish the splint was on the side instead of the palm, but it does well enough to prevent bending.

customer_reviews.title: Finally!
customer_reviews.text: The metal stays are heavenly. I have problems with my joints from Ehlers Danlos Syndrome, and purchased a pair. Can't beat the price, and keeps my wrists stable. I thought at first the stays weren't adjustable, but you can bend them to better fit your wrist/palm.
customer_reviews.author: PunkiGray

customer_reviews.title: Get this for your carpal tunnel. NOW !
customer_reviews.text: I had one just like it that was 2 years old. Needed another for the other wrist. Works like a charm even though I resemble a prizefighter when I get into bed!😂😂😂
customer_reviews.author: A. Peake

customer_reviews.title: Buy this and you won't regret it
customer_reviews.text: I have carpal tunnel syndrome in both wrists and stability issues in one from a broken arm so I have to wear wrist braces every night. After much trial and error trying to find something that offers great support without being uncomfortable these are the clear winner. Easy to wash, I replace mine about once every 18 months because the Velcro wears out, but I also wear them every single night. Great product, great price! They are the only thing that lets me keep doing the things I love.
customer_reviews.author: K.O.M.

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great for me.
customer_reviews.text: Nice, but I wish it was just a little more firm. This is fine on my left wrist, which doesn't cause as much problem. Tried it on my right wrist which is the more problematic, and it started hurting after a while, so I went back to the previous style I had been using. Short term, it's okay, though. It is, however, more comfortable to leave on when I walk away from the keyboard, so people with moderate discomfort might prefer this.
customer_reviews.author: Donna C.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't make your hand sweat
customer_reviews.text: This type of wrist support is soft and supportive. It's my favorite. My hand doesn't sweat and that's a real plus. I just replaced a missing one.
customer_reviews.author: J3 user

product_meta.title: FUTURO Comfort Stabilizing Wrist Brace, Breathable, One Size
product_meta.description: When your wrist is feeling sensitive, reach for the stabilizing support of the FUTURO Comfort Stabilzing Wrist Brace. Whether an old injury is flaring up or you sprained your wrist at the gym, this wrist brace features a palmar stay for extra support and a convenient sleeve design for easy on, easy off. Three straps help you achieve your desired amount of support, and the ergonomic design allows you to retain full mobility in your fingers. Slip on the supportive comfort of the FUTURO Comfort Stabilizing Wrist Brace.
feature_bullets: Provides moderate-stabilizing support to sore, weak and injured wrists
Breathable, lightweight materials for all-day comfort
Low-cut design lets your fingers move naturally
Three-strap, hook-and-loop design for custom comfort
Palmar splint adjusts for customizable support
Wear on either wrist for versatility
Supported by our expert panel of engineers and medical professionals

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
